job_tasks.phrase: Assisting researchers and students to efficiently deploy scientific workloads on the various AI platforms (NVIDIA DGX B200, local clusters, SURF, Azure and Rescale)
job_tasks.justification: This task involves helping users deploy their scientific applications (workloads) onto existing AI infrastructure, which is a form of integrating applications with platforms.

job_tasks.phrase: Working with researchers to understand and optimize their application (benchmarking, code optimization)
job_tasks.justification: Optimizing application code and understanding its performance falls under the umbrella of software development and integration, focusing on making existing applications run better on specific platforms.

job_tasks.phrase: Optimizing application workflows and pipelines (training/inferencing, pre-processing, simulation, post-processing, data storage, etc.) to make the best use of a given platform
job_tasks.justification: This task directly relates to optimizing the operational aspects of running applications and workflows on AI platforms, which aligns with MLOps principles for efficient resource utilization and pipeline management.
Benchmarking and managing workloads (administration/accounting) are operational tasks focused on the performance and resource management of deployed applications and infrastructure.

job_tasks.phrase: help us build and professionalize this innovative service
job_tasks.justification: This phrase indicates a role in developing and improving a service, which requires understanding the business context and strategic goals of the HPC Lab.

job_tasks.phrase: You will closely work with researchers, students of all departments, and TU/e institutes as well as with industry partners.
job_tasks.justification: This highlights the need to understand the needs of various stakeholders (researchers, students, institutes, partners), which is a key aspect of business understanding and stakeholder management.

job_tasks.phrase: you want to offer them a solution for tomorrow that doesn't exist today.
job_tasks.justification: This points to understanding future needs and developing innovative solutions, aligning with business strategy and forward-thinking.
Directly mentions training and communication, which are core components of this soft skill category.
These adjectives describe a mindset of taking initiative, being responsible, and driving work forward, which aligns with innovation and ownership.

job_tasks.justification: These questions imply a desire for continuous growth, learning, and facing new challenges, which are hallmarks of learning and adaptability.

profile.rationale: The job description focuses heavily on assisting researchers with deploying and optimizing scientific workloads and application workflows on AI platforms (Macro-Category A tasks like 1.A.1 and 1.A.2). While AI/ML infrastructure is mentioned (NVIDIA DGX, Azure, etc.), the core responsibilities are about supporting users and optimizing existing applications and workflows rather than developing new AI models or GenAI-specific features (Macro-Category B tasks are absent). The role is about enabling others to use AI/ML effectively within a provided infrastructure, fitting the profile of an AI-Adjacent Software Engineer.

confidence.reasoning: The job ad clearly outlines responsibilities related to application support, optimization, and workflow management on AI platforms. It lacks any mention of core AI/ML model development or GenAI specialization tasks. The focus is on the 'application and workflow side' of AI/HPC infrastructure. This makes the classification relatively straightforward, though the 'AI/ML Application Support Engineer' title could be interpreted in slightly different ways, hence not a perfect 5.
